results.title: Not wanted: pollution
results.brief_description: The forest industry is the main export industry in Sweden, but it is also the main polluter of the water courses in the country. In 1969 Sweden made new stringent environmental protection laws, and in 1970 the pulp industry began pollution control projects. Investment requirements in the pollution control sector are considerable and in order to obtain the best possible basis for these investments, a research project - The Forest Industries’ Water and Air Pollution Research Laboratory - was started. Some examples of pollution control measures in the pulp industry are shown.

results.title: Not wanted on voyage
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Eric Thompson and Hugh Alexander
results.brief_description: An account of the work being done by the Commonwealth Plant Quarantine officers to prevent the introduction of dangerous insect pests and plant diseases into this country from overseas. In addition to checking cargoes on arrival at Australian ports, quarantine officers extend their vigilance to overseas loading points in their efforts to keep Australia free of diseases prevalent in other countries.

results.title: Not to lose you my language: bilingual education in the Northern Territory = Wangka walytjalampa titu ngaranytjaku
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read, Malcolm Otton and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: Gives an impression of the day-to-day operation of the Aboriginal bilingual program in three widely separated schools in the Northern Territory: Milingimbi, Yuendumu and the outstation of Yayayi.

results.title: Not the 9 O'clock News: Gorilla kinda lingers
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the best of “Not the 9 O’clock News”, the groundbreaking British comedy series which took the mickey out of all that was, and still is, sacred and dear to the British public in the mid-1980s. 129 hard-hitting satirical barbs in 99-minutes of side-splitting humour.

results.title: Not so much a desert, more a way of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
Much of the surface of Australia is described as desert. But is this a true description? Wherever he looks, David Bellamy finds life among the sand and rocks.

results.title: Not so fast Songololo
results.brief_description: Set in South Africa, this is a simple story of mutual love between a child and his grandmother. The young boy, Shepard (Songololo to his grandmother), who likes to do things slowly, is enlisted by his grandmother Gogo to assist her on a shopping trip to the city. She is an old woman, not quite in step with modern technology, no longer moving quickly. Love, respect and humour flow between the two. The boy’s hand-me-down sneakers are worn out and although he doesn’t ask for them, Songololo’s desire for a new pair is evident by his dreamy-eyed window-shopping. Gogo, after observing his behaviour and the condition of his sneakers, makes this day very special by buying him a bright red pair. He is so happy she must call out, “not so fast Songololo”, to persuade him not to race all the way home; she would walk faster, she jokes, if she had new shoes as well. Niki Daly’s watercolour and marker illustrations are vibrant, bright and sure, capturing well the humourous, elderly, weather-worn face of Gogo and Songololo’s youthful, eager expressiveness. Based on the book of the same name by Niki Daly. Suitable for children aged 4-8.

results.title: Not really morning people
results.creator_credit: Renee Rutgrink and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Can’t handle Mondays? Don’t think you can get out of bed tomorrow? Perhaps you’re not really a morning person. A cheeky tour into our morning journeys guided by a couple of observant experts we never really notice.

results.title: Not quite Jerusalem
results.brief_description: Set in a kibbutz, Joanne Pacula and Sam Robards are cast as an Isreali girl and an American volunteer, who meet and fall in love on the kibbutz. Gila (Pacula) is a hardnosed and foulmouthed “kibbutz-nik” who tones down her language when she finds love. Cast includes Kevin McNally, Todd Graff and Selina Cadell.
